what: This is a tutorial about how to use BendingMoment.generation package.
title: Bendingmoment
text: truck travels bridges, use static influence line calculate unit load bending moment. assume truck velocity v(m/s), Observation frequency Hz,get sequence bending moments mid-span bridge within BridgeL/v time, every 1/Hz seconds.           Due limitation resources objective research, instead installing sensors bridge performing real-world experiment, package simulated bending moment experiment computer contribute solving weigh--motion problem. order get close real data, add different level noise data.

previous_headings: This is a tutorial about how to use BendingMoment.generation package.
title: Bendingmoment
text: FHWA agency summarizes nine truck types, common truck types.           9 types trucks, different axle loads axle spacings, example, truck1, two alxe load one spacing two axles, n(loads) = n(spacings) + 1. 0 means axle load.

previous_headings: This is a tutorial about how to use BendingMoment.generation package. > 2. Influence line and Bending moment (6 pts)
title: Bendingmoment
text: Static influence line https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Influence_line defined : \[ IL_m(x(t)) = \begin{cases} x(t) - \frac{x(t)*x_m}{L} & \text{$x(t) \leq x_m$} \\ x_m - \frac{x(t)*x_m}{L} & \text{$x(t) > x_m$}  \end{cases} \]

previous_headings: This is a tutorial about how to use BendingMoment.generation package. > 2. Influence line and Bending moment (6 pts)
what: 2.2 Bending moment of The trucks with multi loads and spacings
title: Bendingmoment
text: Bending moment defined : \[ M(x(t)) = IL_m(x(t))*A_1 + IL_m((x-s_1)(t))*A_2 + IL_m((x-s_1-s_2)(t))*A_3 + \cdots + \\ IL_m((x-s_1 -s_2-s_3 \cdots -s_{n-1})(t))*A_n \]

previous_headings: This is a tutorial about how to use BendingMoment.generation package. > 3. Parameter description
title: Bendingmoment
text: \[ BendingMoment <- function(Trucktype, BridgeL, v, Hz, NoiseLevel) \]
code: param Trucktype: 9 types of trucks, with 1-9   param BridgeL: Length of bridge (m)   param v: velocity of truck (m/s)   param Hz Observation frequency like 50 Hz is observe every 0.02s.   param NoiseLevel Usually 0%, 5%, 10%, 15%, 20% noise to    simulate the real data.   Output Bending_moment: A sequence of bending moments generated at mid-span of bridge, within BridgeL/v time, every 1/Hz seconds.

previous_headings: This is a tutorial about how to use BendingMoment.generation package. > 3. Parameter description
title: Bendingmoment
text: Bending moment data #3 truck 10% level noise within 2 s.
code: param Trucktype: 3   param BridgeL: 100 (m)   param v: 50 (m/s)   param Hz: 50 Hz   param NoiseLevel: 0%
